intro: Pentacalia aquifolia, commonly known as the waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Pentacalia aquifolia is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
